005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.util.datalog.DataLog;
008import java.util.HashMap;
009import java.util.Map;
010import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
011import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
012import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
013import java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition;
014import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
015import java.util.function.Consumer;
016
017/**
018 * NetworkTables Instance.
019 *
020 * <p>Instances are completely independent from each other. Table operations on one instance will
021 * not be visible to other instances unless the instances are connected via the network. The main
022 * limitation on instances is that you cannot have two servers on the same network port. The main
023 * utility of instances is for unit testing, but they can also enable one program to connect to two
024 * different NetworkTables networks.
025 *
026 * <p>The global "default" instance (as returned by {@link #getDefault()}) is always available, and
027 * is intended for the common case when there is only a single NetworkTables instance being used in
028 * the program.
029 *
030 * <p>Additional instances can be created with the {@link #create()} function. A reference must be
031 * kept to the NetworkTableInstance returned by this function to keep it from being garbage
032 * collected.
033 */
034public final class NetworkTableInstance implements AutoCloseable {
035  /**
036   * Client/server mode flag values (as returned by {@link #getNetworkMode()}). This is a bitmask.
037   */
038  public static final int kNetModeNone = 0x00;
039
040  public static final int kNetModeServer = 0x01;
041  public static final int kNetModeClient = 0x02;
042  public static final int kNetModeStarting = 0x04;
043  public static final int kNetModeFailure = 0x08;
044  public static final int kNetModeLocal = 0x10;
045
046  /** The default port that network tables operates on. */
047  public static final int kDefaultPort = 1735;
048
049  /**
050   * Construct from native handle.
051   *
052   * @param handle Native handle
053   */
054  private NetworkTableInstance(int handle) {
055    m_owned = false;
056    m_handle = handle;
057  }
058
059  /** Destroys the instance (if created by {@link #create()}). */
060  @Override
061  public synchronized void close() {
062    if (m_owned && m_handle != 0) {
063      NetworkTablesJNI.destroyInstance(m_handle);
064    }
065  }
066
067  /**
068   * Determines if the native handle is valid.
069   *
070   * @return True if the native handle is valid, false otherwise.
071   */
072  public boolean isValid() {
073    return m_handle != 0;
074  }
075
076  /* The default instance. */
077  private static NetworkTableInstance s_defaultInstance;
078
079  /**
080   * Get global default instance.
081   *
082   * @return Global default instance
083   */
084  public static synchronized NetworkTableInstance getDefault() {
085    if (s_defaultInstance == null) {
086      s_defaultInstance = new NetworkTableInstance(NetworkTablesJNI.getDefaultInstance());
087    }
088    return s_defaultInstance;
089  }
090
091  /**
092   * Create an instance. Note: A reference to the returned instance must be retained to ensure the
093   * instance is not garbage collected.
094   *
095   * @return Newly created instance
096   */
097  public static NetworkTableInstance create() {
098    NetworkTableInstance inst = new NetworkTableInstance(NetworkTablesJNI.createInstance());
099    inst.m_owned = true;
100    return inst;
101  }
102
103  /**
104   * Gets the native handle for the entry.
105   *
106   * @return Native handle
107   */
108  public int getHandle() {
109    return m_handle;
110  }
111
112  /**
113   * Gets the entry for a key.
114   *
115   * @param name Key
116   * @return Network table entry.
117   */
118  public NetworkTableEntry getEntry(String name) {
119    return new NetworkTableEntry(this, NetworkTablesJNI.getEntry(m_handle, name));
120  }
121
122  /**
123   * Get entries starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by string
124   * prefix and entry type to only return a subset of all entries.
125   *
126   * @param prefix entry name required prefix; only entries whose name starts with this string are
127   *     returned
128   * @param types bitmask of types; 0 is treated as a "don't care"
129   * @return Array of entries.
130   */
131  public NetworkTableEntry[] getEntries(String prefix, int types) {
132    int[] handles = NetworkTablesJNI.getEntries(m_handle, prefix, types);
133    NetworkTableEntry[] entries = new NetworkTableEntry[handles.length];
134    for (int i = 0; i < handles.length; i++) {
135      entries[i] = new NetworkTableEntry(this, handles[i]);
136    }
137    return entries;
138  }
139
140  /**
141   * Get information about entries starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally
142   * filtered by string prefix and entry type to only return a subset of all entries.
143   *
144   * @param prefix entry name required prefix; only entries whose name starts with this string are
145   *     returned
146   * @param types bitmask of types; 0 is treated as a "don't care"
147   * @return Array of entry information.
148   */
149  public EntryInfo[] getEntryInfo(String prefix, int types) {
150    return NetworkTablesJNI.getEntryInfo(this, m_handle, prefix, types);
151  }
152
153  /* Cache of created tables. */
154  private final ConcurrentMap<String, NetworkTable> m_tables = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
155
156  /**
157   * Gets the table with the specified key.
158   *
159   * @param key the key name
160   * @return The network table
161   */
162  public NetworkTable getTable(String key) {
163    // prepend leading / if not present
164    String theKey;
165    if (key.isEmpty() || "/".equals(key)) {
166      theKey = "";
167    } else if (key.charAt(0) == NetworkTable.PATH_SEPARATOR) {
168      theKey = key;
169    } else {
170      theKey = NetworkTable.PATH_SEPARATOR + key;
171    }
172
173    // cache created tables
174    NetworkTable table = m_tables.get(theKey);
175    if (table == null) {
176      table = new NetworkTable(this, theKey);
177      NetworkTable oldTable = m_tables.putIfAbsent(theKey, table);
178      if (oldTable != null) {
179        table = oldTable;
180      }
181    }
182    return table;
183  }
184
185  /** Deletes ALL keys in ALL subtables (except persistent values). Use with caution! */
186  public void deleteAllEntries() {
187    NetworkTablesJNI.deleteAllEntries(m_handle);
188  }
189
190  /*
191   * Callback Creation Functions
192   */
193
194  private static class EntryConsumer<T> {
195    final NetworkTableEntry m_entry;
196    final Consumer<T> m_consumer;
197
198    EntryConsumer(NetworkTableEntry entry, Consumer<T> consumer) {
199      m_entry = entry;
200      m_consumer = consumer;
201    }
202  }
203
204  private final ReentrantLock m_entryListenerLock = new ReentrantLock();
205  private final Map<Integer, EntryConsumer<EntryNotification>> m_entryListeners = new HashMap<>();
206  private int m_entryListenerPoller;
207  private boolean m_entryListenerWaitQueue;
208  private final Condition m_entryListenerWaitQueueCond = m_entryListenerLock.newCondition();
209
210  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidCatchingThrowable")
211  private void startEntryListenerThread() {
212    var entryListenerThread =
213        new Thread(
214            () -> {
215              boolean wasInterrupted = false;
216              while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
217                EntryNotification[] events;
218                try {
219                  events = NetworkTablesJNI.pollEntryListener(this, m_entryListenerPoller);
220                } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
221                  m_entryListenerLock.lock();
222                  try {
223                    if (m_entryListenerWaitQueue) {
224                      m_entryListenerWaitQueue = false;
225                      m_entryListenerWaitQueueCond.signalAll();
226                      continue;
227                    }
228                  } finally {
229                    m_entryListenerLock.unlock();
230                  }
231                  Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
232                  // don't try to destroy poller, as its handle is likely no longer valid
233                  wasInterrupted = true;
234                  break;
235                }
236                for (EntryNotification event : events) {
237                  EntryConsumer<EntryNotification> listener;
238                  m_entryListenerLock.lock();
239                  try {
240                    listener = m_entryListeners.get(event.listener);
241                  } finally {
242                    m_entryListenerLock.unlock();
243                  }
244                  if (listener != null) {
245                    event.m_entryObject = listener.m_entry;
246                    try {
247                      listener.m_consumer.accept(event);
248                    } catch (Throwable throwable) {
249                      System.err.println(
250                          "Unhandled exception during entry listener callback: "
251                              + throwable.toString());
252                      throwable.printStackTrace();
253                    }
254                  }
255                }
256              }
257              m_entryListenerLock.lock();
258              try {
259                if (!wasInterrupted) {
260                  NetworkTablesJNI.destroyEntryListenerPoller(m_entryListenerPoller);
261                }
262                m_entryListenerPoller = 0;
263              } finally {
264                m_entryListenerLock.unlock();
265              }
266            },
267            "NTEntryListener");
268    entryListenerThread.setDaemon(true);
269    entryListenerThread.start();
270  }
271
272  /**
273   * Add a listener for all entries starting with a certain prefix.
274   *
275   * @param prefix UTF-8 string prefix
276   * @param listener listener to add
277   * @param flags {@link EntryListenerFlags} bitmask
278   * @return Listener handle
279   */
280  public int addEntryListener(String prefix, Consumer<EntryNotification> listener, int flags) {
281    m_entryListenerLock.lock();
282    try {
283      if (m_entryListenerPoller == 0) {
284        m_entryListenerPoller = NetworkTablesJNI.createEntryListenerPoller(m_handle);
285        startEntryListenerThread();
286      }
287      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledEntryListener(m_entryListenerPoller, prefix, flags);
288      m_entryListeners.put(handle, new EntryConsumer<>(null, listener));
289      return handle;
290    } finally {
291      m_entryListenerLock.unlock();
292    }
293  }
294
295  /**
296   * Add a listener for a particular entry.
297   *
298   * @param entry the entry
299   * @param listener listener to add
300   * @param flags {@link EntryListenerFlags} bitmask
301   * @return Listener handle
302   */
303  public int addEntryListener(
304      NetworkTableEntry entry, Consumer<EntryNotification> listener, int flags) {
305    if (!equals(entry.getInstance())) {
306      throw new IllegalArgumentException("entry does not belong to this instance");
307    }
308    m_entryListenerLock.lock();
309    try {
310      if (m_entryListenerPoller == 0) {
311        m_entryListenerPoller = NetworkTablesJNI.createEntryListenerPoller(m_handle);
312        startEntryListenerThread();
313      }
314      int handle =
315          NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledEntryListener(m_entryListenerPoller, entry.getHandle(), flags);
316      m_entryListeners.put(handle, new EntryConsumer<>(entry, listener));
317      return handle;
318    } finally {
319      m_entryListenerLock.unlock();
320    }
321  }
322
323  /**
324   * Remove an entry listener.
325   *
326   * @param listener Listener handle to remove
327   */
328  public void removeEntryListener(int listener) {
329    NetworkTablesJNI.removeEntryListener(listener);
330  }
331
332  /**
333   * Wait for the entry listener queue to be empty. This is primarily useful for deterministic
334   * testing. This blocks until either the entry listener queue is empty (e.g. there are no more
335   * events that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
336   *
337   * @param timeout timeout, in seconds. Set to 0 for non-blocking behavior, or a negative value to
338   *     block indefinitely
339   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.
340   */
341  public boolean waitForEntryListenerQueue(double timeout) {
342    if (!NetworkTablesJNI.waitForEntryListenerQueue(m_handle, timeout)) {
343      return false;
344    }
345    m_entryListenerLock.lock();
346    try {
347      if (m_entryListenerPoller != 0) {
348        m_entryListenerWaitQueue = true;
349        NetworkTablesJNI.cancelPollEntryListener(m_entryListenerPoller);
350        while (m_entryListenerWaitQueue) {
351          try {
352            if (timeout < 0) {
353              m_entryListenerWaitQueueCond.await();
354            } else {
355              return m_entryListenerWaitQueueCond.await(
356                  (long) (timeout * 1e9), TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS);
357            }
358          } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
359            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
360            return true;
361          }
362        }
363      }
364    } finally {
365      m_entryListenerLock.unlock();
366    }
367    return true;
368  }
369
370  private final ReentrantLock m_connectionListenerLock = new ReentrantLock();
371  private final Map<Integer, Consumer<ConnectionNotification>> m_connectionListeners =
372      new HashMap<>();
373  private int m_connectionListenerPoller;
374  private boolean m_connectionListenerWaitQueue;
375  private final Condition m_connectionListenerWaitQueueCond =
376      m_connectionListenerLock.newCondition();
377
378  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidCatchingThrowable")
379  private void startConnectionListenerThread() {
380    var connectionListenerThread =
381        new Thread(
382            () -> {
383              boolean wasInterrupted = false;
384              while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
385                ConnectionNotification[] events;
386                try {
387                  events =
388                      NetworkTablesJNI.pollConnectionListener(this, m_connectionListenerPoller);
389                } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
390                  m_connectionListenerLock.lock();
391                  try {
392                    if (m_connectionListenerWaitQueue) {
393                      m_connectionListenerWaitQueue = false;
394                      m_connectionListenerWaitQueueCond.signalAll();
395                      continue;
396                    }
397                  } finally {
398                    m_connectionListenerLock.unlock();
399                  }
400                  Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
401                  // don't try to destroy poller, as its handle is likely no longer valid
402                  wasInterrupted = true;
403                  break;
404                }
405                for (ConnectionNotification event : events) {
406                  Consumer<ConnectionNotification> listener;
407                  m_connectionListenerLock.lock();
408                  try {
409                    listener = m_connectionListeners.get(event.listener);
410                  } finally {
411                    m_connectionListenerLock.unlock();
412                  }
413                  if (listener != null) {
414                    try {
415                      listener.accept(event);
416                    } catch (Throwable throwable) {
417                      System.err.println(
418                          "Unhandled exception during connection listener callback: "
419                              + throwable.toString());
420                      throwable.printStackTrace();
421                    }
422                  }
423                }
424              }
425              m_connectionListenerLock.lock();
426              try {
427                if (!wasInterrupted) {
428                  NetworkTablesJNI.destroyConnectionListenerPoller(m_connectionListenerPoller);
429                }
430                m_connectionListenerPoller = 0;
431              } finally {
432                m_connectionListenerLock.unlock();
433              }
434            },
435            "NTConnectionListener");
436    connectionListenerThread.setDaemon(true);
437    connectionListenerThread.start();
438  }
439
440  /**
441   * Add a connection listener.
442   *
443   * @param listener Listener to add
444   * @param immediateNotify Notify listener of all existing connections
445   * @return Listener handle
446   */
447  public int addConnectionListener(
448      Consumer<ConnectionNotification> listener, boolean immediateNotify) {
449    m_connectionListenerLock.lock();
450    try {
451      if (m_connectionListenerPoller == 0) {
452        m_connectionListenerPoller = NetworkTablesJNI.createConnectionListenerPoller(m_handle);
453        startConnectionListenerThread();
454      }
455      int handle =
456          NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledConnectionListener(m_connectionListenerPoller, immediateNotify);
457      m_connectionListeners.put(handle, listener);
458      return handle;
459    } finally {
460      m_connectionListenerLock.unlock();
461    }
462  }
463
464  /**
465   * Remove a connection listener.
466   *
467   * @param listener Listener handle to remove
468   */
469  public void removeConnectionListener(int listener) {
470    m_connectionListenerLock.lock();
471    try {
472      m_connectionListeners.remove(listener);
473    } finally {
474      m_connectionListenerLock.unlock();
475    }
476    NetworkTablesJNI.removeConnectionListener(listener);
477  }
478
479  /**
480   * Wait for the connection listener queue to be empty. This is primarily useful for deterministic
481   * testing. This blocks until either the connection listener queue is empty (e.g. there are no
482   * more events that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
483   *
484   * @param timeout timeout, in seconds. Set to 0 for non-blocking behavior, or a negative value to
485   *     block indefinitely
486   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.
487   */
488  public boolean waitForConnectionListenerQueue(double timeout) {
489    if (!NetworkTablesJNI.waitForConnectionListenerQueue(m_handle, timeout)) {
490      return false;
491    }
492    m_connectionListenerLock.lock();
493    try {
494      if (m_connectionListenerPoller != 0) {
495        m_connectionListenerWaitQueue = true;
496        NetworkTablesJNI.cancelPollConnectionListener(m_connectionListenerPoller);
497        while (m_connectionListenerWaitQueue) {
498          try {
499            if (timeout < 0) {
500              m_connectionListenerWaitQueueCond.await();
501            } else {
502              return m_connectionListenerWaitQueueCond.await(
503                  (long) (timeout * 1e9), TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS);
504            }
505          } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
506            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
507            return true;
508          }
509        }
510      }
511    } finally {
512      m_connectionListenerLock.unlock();
513    }
514    return true;
515  }
516
517  /*
518   * Remote Procedure Call Functions
519   */
520
521  private final ReentrantLock m_rpcCallLock = new ReentrantLock();
522  private final Map<Integer, EntryConsumer<RpcAnswer>> m_rpcCalls = new HashMap<>();
523  private int m_rpcCallPoller;
524  private boolean m_rpcCallWaitQueue;
525  private final Condition m_rpcCallWaitQueueCond = m_rpcCallLock.newCondition();
526
527  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidCatchingThrowable")
528  private void startRpcCallThread() {
529    var rpcCallThread =
530        new Thread(
531            () -> {
532              boolean wasInterrupted = false;
533              while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
534                RpcAnswer[] events;
535                try {
536                  events = NetworkTablesJNI.pollRpc(this, m_rpcCallPoller);
537                } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
538                  m_rpcCallLock.lock();
539                  try {
540                    if (m_rpcCallWaitQueue) {
541                      m_rpcCallWaitQueue = false;
542                      m_rpcCallWaitQueueCond.signalAll();
543                      continue;
544                    }
545                  } finally {
546                    m_rpcCallLock.unlock();
547                  }
548                  Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
549                  // don't try to destroy poller, as its handle is likely no longer valid
550                  wasInterrupted = true;
551                  break;
552                }
553                for (RpcAnswer event : events) {
554                  EntryConsumer<RpcAnswer> listener;
555                  m_rpcCallLock.lock();
556                  try {
557                    listener = m_rpcCalls.get(event.entry);
558                  } finally {
559                    m_rpcCallLock.unlock();
560                  }
561                  if (listener != null) {
562                    event.m_entryObject = listener.m_entry;
563                    try {
564                      listener.m_consumer.accept(event);
565                    } catch (Throwable throwable) {
566                      System.err.println(
567                          "Unhandled exception during RPC callback: " + throwable.toString());
568                      throwable.printStackTrace();
569                    }
570                    event.finish();
571                  }
572                }
573              }
574              m_rpcCallLock.lock();
575              try {
576                if (!wasInterrupted) {
577                  NetworkTablesJNI.destroyRpcCallPoller(m_rpcCallPoller);
578                }
579                m_rpcCallPoller = 0;
580              } finally {
581                m_rpcCallLock.unlock();
582              }
583            },
584            "NTRpcCall");
585    rpcCallThread.setDaemon(true);
586    rpcCallThread.start();
587  }
588
589  private static final byte[] rev0def = new byte[] {0};
590
591  /**
592   * Create a callback-based RPC entry point. Only valid to use on the server. The callback function
593   * will be called when the RPC is called. This function creates RPC version 0 definitions (raw
594   * data in and out).
595   *
596   * @param entry the entry
597   * @param callback callback function
598   */
599  public void createRpc(NetworkTableEntry entry, Consumer<RpcAnswer> callback) {
600    m_rpcCallLock.lock();
601    try {
602      if (m_rpcCallPoller == 0) {
603        m_rpcCallPoller = NetworkTablesJNI.createRpcCallPoller(m_handle);
604        startRpcCallThread();
605      }
606      NetworkTablesJNI.createPolledRpc(entry.getHandle(), rev0def, m_rpcCallPoller);
607      m_rpcCalls.put(entry.getHandle(), new EntryConsumer<>(entry, callback));
608    } finally {
609      m_rpcCallLock.unlock();
610    }
611  }
612
613  /**
614   * Wait for the incoming RPC call queue to be empty. This is primarily useful for deterministic
615   * testing. This blocks until either the RPC call queue is empty (e.g. there are no more events
616   * that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
617   *
618   * @param timeout timeout, in seconds. Set to 0 for non-blocking behavior, or a negative value to
619   *     block indefinitely
620   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.
621   */
622  public boolean waitForRpcCallQueue(double timeout) {
623    if (!NetworkTablesJNI.waitForRpcCallQueue(m_handle, timeout)) {
624      return false;
625    }
626    m_rpcCallLock.lock();
627    try {
628      if (m_rpcCallPoller != 0) {
629        m_rpcCallWaitQueue = true;
630        NetworkTablesJNI.cancelPollRpc(m_rpcCallPoller);
631        while (m_rpcCallWaitQueue) {
632          try {
633            if (timeout < 0) {
634              m_rpcCallWaitQueueCond.await();
635            } else {
636              return m_rpcCallWaitQueueCond.await((long) (timeout * 1e9), TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS);
637            }
638          } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
639            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
640            return true;
641          }
642        }
643      }
644    } finally {
645      m_rpcCallLock.unlock();
646    }
647    return true;
648  }
649
650  /*
651   * Client/Server Functions
652   */
653
654  /**
655   * Set the network identity of this node. This is the name used during the initial connection
656   * handshake, and is visible through ConnectionInfo on the remote node.
657   *
658   * @param name identity to advertise
659   */
660  public void setNetworkIdentity(String name) {
661    NetworkTablesJNI.setNetworkIdentity(m_handle, name);
662  }
663
664  /**
665   * Get the current network mode.
666   *
667   * @return Bitmask of NetworkMode.
668   */
669  public int getNetworkMode() {
670    return NetworkTablesJNI.getNetworkMode(m_handle);
671  }
672
673  /**
674   * Starts local-only operation. Prevents calls to startServer or startClient from taking effect.
675   * Has no effect if startServer or startClient has already been called.
676   */
677  public void startLocal() {
678    NetworkTablesJNI.startLocal(m_handle);
679  }
680
681  /**
682   * Stops local-only operation. startServer or startClient can be called after this call to start a
683   * server or client.
684   */
685  public void stopLocal() {
686    NetworkTablesJNI.stopLocal(m_handle);
687  }
688
689  /**
690   * Starts a server using the networktables.ini as the persistent file, using the default listening
691   * address and port.
692   */
693  public void startServer() {
694    startServer("networktables.ini");
695  }
696
697  /**
698   * Starts a server using the specified persistent filename, using the default listening address
699   * and port.
700   *
701   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
702   */
703  public void startServer(String persistFilename) {
704    startServer(persistFilename, "");
705  }
706
707  /**
708   * Starts a server using the specified filename and listening address, using the default port.
709   *
710   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
711   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
712   */
713  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress) {
714    startServer(persistFilename, listenAddress, kDefaultPort);
715  }
716
717  /**
718   * Starts a server using the specified filename, listening address, and port.
719   *
720   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
721   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
722   * @param port port to communicate over
723   */
724  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress, int port) {
725    NetworkTablesJNI.startServer(m_handle, persistFilename, listenAddress, port);
726  }
727
728  /** Stops the server if it is running. */
729  public void stopServer() {
730    NetworkTablesJNI.stopServer(m_handle);
731  }
732
733  /** Starts a client. Use SetServer to set the server name and port. */
734  public void startClient() {
735    NetworkTablesJNI.startClient(m_handle);
736  }
737
738  /**
739   * Starts a client using the specified server and the default port.
740   *
741   * @param serverName server name
742   */
743  public void startClient(String serverName) {
744    startClient(serverName, kDefaultPort);
745  }
746
747  /**
748   * Starts a client using the specified server and port.
749   *
750   * @param serverName server name
751   * @param port port to communicate over
752   */
753  public void startClient(String serverName, int port) {
754    NetworkTablesJNI.startClient(m_handle, serverName, port);
755  }
756
757  /**
758   * Starts a client using the specified servers and default port. The client will attempt to
759   * connect to each server in round robin fashion.
760   *
761   * @param serverNames array of server names
762   */
763  public void startClient(String[] serverNames) {
764    startClient(serverNames, kDefaultPort);
765  }
766
767  /**
768   * Starts a client using the specified servers and port number. The client will attempt to connect
769   * to each server in round robin fashion.
770   *
771   * @param serverNames array of server names
772   * @param port port to communicate over
773   */
774  public void startClient(String[] serverNames, int port) {
775    int[] ports = new int[serverNames.length];
776    for (int i = 0; i < serverNames.length; i++) {
777      ports[i] = port;
778    }
779    startClient(serverNames, ports);
780  }
781

783   * Starts a client using the specified (server, port) combinations. The client will attempt to
784   * connect to each server in round robin fashion.
785   *
786   * @param serverNames array of server names
787   * @param ports array of port numbers
788   */
789  public void startClient(String[] serverNames, int[] ports) {
790    NetworkTablesJNI.startClient(m_handle, serverNames, ports);
791  }

926  }

928  /**
929   * Flushes all updated values immediately to the network. Note: This is rate-limited to protect
930   * the network from flooding. This is primarily useful for synchronizing network updates with user
931   * code.
932   */
933  public void flush() {
934    NetworkTablesJNI.flush(m_handle);
935  }

964  }
965
966  /**
967   * Loads persistent keys from a file. The server does this automatically.
968   *
969   * @param filename file name
970   * @return List of warnings (errors result in an exception instead)
971   * @throws PersistentException if error reading file
972   */
973  public String[] loadPersistent(String filename) throws PersistentException {
974    return NetworkTablesJNI.loadPersistent(m_handle, filename);
975  }

983   */
984  public void saveEntries(String filename, String prefix) throws PersistentException {
985    NetworkTablesJNI.saveEntries(m_handle, filename, prefix);
986  }

994   * @return List of warnings (errors result in an exception instead)

997  public String[] loadEntries(String filename, String prefix) throws PersistentException {

1001  /**
1002   * Starts logging entry changes to a DataLog.
1003   *
1004   * @param log data log object; lifetime must extend until StopEntryDataLog is called or the
1005   *     instance is destroyed
1006   * @param prefix only store entries with names that start with this prefix; the prefix is not
1007   *     included in the data log entry name
1008   * @param logPrefix prefix to add to data log entry names
1009   * @return Data logger handle
1010   */
1011  public int startEntryDataLog(DataLog log, String prefix, String logPrefix) {
1012    return NetworkTablesJNI.startEntryDataLog(m_handle, log, prefix, logPrefix);
1013  }
1014
1015  /**
1016   * Stops logging entry changes to a DataLog.
1017   *
1018   * @param logger data logger handle
1019   */
1020  public static void stopEntryDataLog(int logger) {
1021    NetworkTablesJNI.stopEntryDataLog(logger);
1022  }
1023
1024  /**
1025   * Starts logging connection changes to a DataLog.
1026   *
1027   * @param log data log object; lifetime must extend until StopConnectionDataLog is called or the
1028   *     instance is destroyed
1029   * @param name data log entry name
1030   * @return Data logger handle
1031   */
1032  public int startConnectionDataLog(DataLog log, String name) {
1033    return NetworkTablesJNI.startConnectionDataLog(m_handle, log, name);
1034  }
1035
1036  /**
1037   * Stops logging connection changes to a DataLog.
1038   *
1039   * @param logger data logger handle
1040   */
1041  public static void stopConnectionDataLog(int logger) {
1042    NetworkTablesJNI.stopConnectionDataLog(logger);
1043  }
1044
1045  private final ReentrantLock m_loggerLock = new ReentrantLock();
1046  private final Map<Integer, Consumer<LogMessage>> m_loggers = new HashMap<>();
1047  private int m_loggerPoller;
1048  private boolean m_loggerWaitQueue;
1049  private final Condition m_loggerWaitQueueCond = m_loggerLock.newCondition();
1050
1051  @SuppressWarnings("PMD.AvoidCatchingThrowable")
1052  private void startLogThread() {
1053    var loggerThread =
1054        new Thread(
1055            () -> {
1056              boolean wasInterrupted = false;
1057              while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
1058                LogMessage[] events;
1059                try {
1060                  events = NetworkTablesJNI.pollLogger(this, m_loggerPoller);
1061                } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1062                  Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1063                  // don't try to destroy poller, as its handle is likely no longer valid
1064                  wasInterrupted = true;
1065                  break;
1066                }
1067                for (LogMessage event : events) {
1068                  Consumer<LogMessage> logger;
1069                  m_loggerLock.lock();
1070                  try {
1071                    logger = m_loggers.get(event.logger);
1072                  } finally {
1073                    m_loggerLock.unlock();
1074                  }
1075                  if (logger != null) {
1076                    try {
1077                      logger.accept(event);
1078                    } catch (Throwable throwable) {
1079                      System.err.println(
1080                          "Unhandled exception during logger callback: " + throwable.toString());
1081                      throwable.printStackTrace();
1082                    }
1083                  }
1084                }
1085              }
1086              m_loggerLock.lock();
1087              try {
1088                if (!wasInterrupted) {
1089                  NetworkTablesJNI.destroyLoggerPoller(m_loggerPoller);
1090                }
1091                m_rpcCallPoller = 0;
1092              } finally {
1093                m_loggerLock.unlock();
1094              }
1095            },
1096            "NTLogger");
1097    loggerThread.setDaemon(true);
1098    loggerThread.start();
1099  }
1100
1101  /**
1102   * Add logger callback function. By default, log messages are sent to stderr; this function sends
1103   * log messages with the specified levels to the provided callback function instead. The callback
1104   * function will only be called for log messages with level greater than or equal to minLevel and
1105   * less than or equal to maxLevel; messages outside this range will be silently ignored.
1106   *
1107   * @param func log callback function
1108   * @param minLevel minimum log level
1109   * @param maxLevel maximum log level
1110   * @return Logger handle
1111   */
1112  public int addLogger(Consumer<LogMessage> func, int minLevel, int maxLevel) {
1113    m_loggerLock.lock();
1114    try {
1115      if (m_loggerPoller == 0) {
1116        m_loggerPoller = NetworkTablesJNI.createLoggerPoller(m_handle);
1117        startLogThread();
1118      }
1119      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.addPolledLogger(m_loggerPoller, minLevel, maxLevel);
1120      m_loggers.put(handle, func);
1121      return handle;
1122    } finally {
1123      m_loggerLock.unlock();
1124    }
1125  }
1126
1127  /**
1128   * Remove a logger.
1129   *
1130   * @param logger Logger handle to remove
1131   */
1132  public void removeLogger(int logger) {
1133    m_loggerLock.lock();
1134    try {
1135      m_loggers.remove(logger);
1136    } finally {
1137      m_loggerLock.unlock();
1138    }
1139    NetworkTablesJNI.removeLogger(logger);
1140  }
1141
1142  /**
1143   * Wait for the incoming log event queue to be empty. This is primarily useful for deterministic
1144   * testing. This blocks until either the log event queue is empty (e.g. there are no more events
1145   * that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
1146   *
1147   * @param timeout timeout, in seconds. Set to 0 for non-blocking behavior, or a negative value to
1148   *     block indefinitely
1149   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.
1150   */
1151  public boolean waitForLoggerQueue(double timeout) {
1152    if (!NetworkTablesJNI.waitForLoggerQueue(m_handle, timeout)) {
1153      return false;
1154    }
1155    m_loggerLock.lock();
1156    try {
1157      if (m_loggerPoller != 0) {
1158        m_loggerWaitQueue = true;
1159        NetworkTablesJNI.cancelPollLogger(m_loggerPoller);
1160        while (m_loggerWaitQueue) {
1161          try {
1162            if (timeout < 0) {
1163              m_loggerWaitQueueCond.await();
1164            } else {
1165              return m_loggerWaitQueueCond.await((long) (timeout * 1e9), TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS);
1166            }
1167          } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
1168            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
1169            return true;
1170          }
1171        }
1172      }
1173    } finally {
1174      m_loggerLock.unlock();
1175    }
1176    return true;
1177  }
1178
1179  @Override
1180  public boolean equals(Object other) {
1181    if (other == this) {
1182      return true;
1183    }
1184    if (!(other instanceof NetworkTableInstance)) {
1185      return false;
1186    }
1187
1188    return m_handle == ((NetworkTableInstance) other).m_handle;
1189  }
1190
1191  @Override
1192  public int hashCode() {
1193    return m_handle;
1194  }
1195
1196  private boolean m_owned;
1197  private final int m_handle;
1198}
